intro: Echium australe, commonly known as the Australian fleabane, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils and saline environments. Echium australe produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. It is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soils and support local wildlife.
